description: The Bibliographic Reference Ontology (BiRO) allows the description of reference lists and bibliographic references themselves.  In particular, BiRO uses an [OWL-based definition of the FRBR model](http://www.sparontologies.net/ontologies/frbr) to define bibliographic references and their compilation into ordered bibliographic lists, by means of the [Collections Ontology](http://purl.org/co), as shown in the following figure.
name: Bibliographic Reference Ontology (BiRO)
